caption.en: The SS Exodus was intercepted by the British and towed in Haifa. Then, the immigrants were deported to France, where they refused to disembark the ship, and finally to Germany, where they were forced to disembark and returned to DP camps.
Jews in DP camps embarked on the SS Exodus, reaching the port through  an underground network named Brichah

Leaving from Italy, Af Al Pi was a repurposed ship that aimed entering the British Mandate for immigration. The Af Al PI Chen was captured by the British, but not without resistance, resulting in 1 dead and 10 injured. The ship was towed in Haifa and the jews were deported to Cyprus

Organized by Betar, teh Noemijulia ship departed from Romania with more than 1000 passengers, but unfortunately, after passive resistance, the ship was boarded by the British at sea, towed in Haifa and the passengers were detained in Sarafand.
Main group 14 route to the British Mandate
The boats intercepted by the British Blockade were sent to Carolos Internment camp, but managed to finally go to the British Mandate of Palestine

A ship named Dora sailed from Netherlands containing 500 passangers, mostly German Jews that had escaped to Holland. 160 passangers disembarked on Antwerp, Belgium. The news reported that the boat was heading to Siam, but it managed to go to the British Mandate of Palestine undetected instead.
Some of the immigrants were caught by French Authorities, sent to Gnadendwald, forcuibly extradicted to Saalfelden, but escaped a week later to Brenner Pass
